enums.name: Direction
enums.summary: Defines the primary axis for layout operations

enums.name: Box3Field
enums.summary: Fields of a 3D box, used to describe position and size components
enums.enum: Width of the box along the X axis
Height of the box along the Y axis
Depth of the box along the Z axis

enums.name: TextHorizontalAlignment
enums.summary: Horizontal text alignment options within text bounds
enums.enum: Align text to the left edge
Align text to the right edge

enums.name: TextVerticalAlignment
enums.summary: Vertical text alignment options within text bounds

enums.name: HorizontalAlignment
enums.summary: Horizontal alignment of elements within their parent container
enums.enum: Align to left edge of container
Align to right edge of container

enums.name: VerticalAlignment
enums.summary: Vertical alignment of elements within their parent container
enums.enum: Align to top edge of container
Align to bottom edge of container

enums.name: AlignItems
enums.summary: Cross-axis alignment in flexbox-style layout containers
enums.enum: Align to start of cross axis
Align to end of cross axis

enums.name: DepthAlignment
enums.summary: 3D depth alignment options for positioning along Z-axis

enums.name: Overflow
enums.summary: Content overflow handling strategies

enums.name: JustifyContent
enums.summary: Main-axis content distribution in flexbox-style layouts

enums.name: FontWeight
enums.summary: Font weight options for typography

enums.name: FontStyle
enums.summary: Font style options for typography

enums.name: BorderStyle
enums.summary: Visual styles for element borders

enums.name: PlaybackMode
enums.summary: Animation playback behavior modes
enums.enum: Reverse playback from end to start

enums.name: ButtonType
enums.summary: Button behavior types for different interaction patterns
enums.enum: Form submission button with special handling

enums.name: InputType
enums.summary: Input control behavior types for different data entry needs

enums.name: Sizing
enums.summary: Size calculation modes for layout operations

struct.name: BorderRadiusShorthand
struct.summary: Corner rounding configuration for rectangular elements
struct.details: Similar to CSS border-radius, allows independent control of each corner's rounding radius.

struct.name: BorderEdgeShorthand
struct.summary: Complete border definition for one edge

struct.name: BorderSideShorthand
struct.summary: Border definitions for both sides of an axis

struct.name: BorderShorthand
struct.summary: Complete border definition for rectangular element
struct.shorthand: Shorthand for setting spacing inside a node along its edges. Represents the inner spacing (padding) between the node's content and its border for all edges. Similar to the CSS `padding` shorthand property.
Shorthand for defining the line style of borders along each edge. Specifies the border style (solid, dashed, etc.) per edge, similar to CSS `border-style`.
Shorthand for defining the color of borders along each edge. Specifies the border color for each edge individually, similar to CSS `border-color`.

struct.name: EdgeShorthand
struct.summary: Spacing values for opposite edges of an axis
struct.field: Leading edge value (left for horizontal, top for vertical, near for depth)
Trailing edge value (right for horizontal, bottom for vertical, far for depth)

struct.name: AlignmentShorthand
struct.details: Stores per-axis alignment information (e.g., Horizontal, Vertical, Depth). Used by Node and its derived classes to control alignment.
struct.field: Alignment of the element within its parent (similar to HorizontalAlignment/VerticalAlignment in XAML).

struct.name: FontShorthand
struct.summary: Complete font specification including weight, style, size, and family

struct.name: BrushShorthand
struct.summary: Represents a generic brush used for filling UI elements.
struct.details: A brush can be used as a background, foreground, or any paintable property. It supports multiple types of fills; each field corresponds to one type of fill.
struct.field: Solid color fill. Conceptually similar to a CSS `color` or `background-color`.
Texture/image fill. Conceptually similar to a CSS `background-image`.
Custom material or shader fill. Advanced fill using shader/material settings for effects beyond simple color or image.

struct.name: ShadowShorthand
struct.details: Defines a drop shadow with offset, blur, spread, and color. Similar to CSS box-shadow property.

struct.name: RingShorthand
struct.details: Creates an outline ring around elements, similar to CSS outline or focus ring indicators. Useful for accessibility and visual feedback.
struct.field: Distance from element edge to ring

struct.name: OverflowShorthand
struct.details: Controls how content that exceeds container bounds is handled for each axis independently.

struct.name: UnderlineShorthand
struct.summary: Defines shorthand underline properties (offset, width, and color).
struct.field: Vertical offset of the underline from the baseline.

struct.name: Thickness
struct.summary: Uniform thickness specification for all four edges
struct.details: Used for properties that need different values for each edge, such as padding, margin, or border thickness.

struct.name: MarginShorthand
struct.summary: External spacing configuration for rectangular elements
struct.details: Similar to CSS margin, allows independent control of each edge external spacing.

struct.name: SizeAxisShorthand
struct.summary: Complete sizing definition for one axis
struct.field: Total {0} size required for scrolling content

struct.name: SizeShorthand
struct.summary: Sizing configuration of elements (e.g., Width, Height, Depth)
struct.details: You can set values and the engine will try it's best to preserve those.

component.name: DataObject
component.summary: Base class for data-holding objects within the framework
component.details: Provides fundamental data management capabilities and serves as the base for objects that participate in data binding operations.

component.name: AnimationPlayer
component.summary: Controls playback of animations within the UI engine.
component.details: Provides functionality for starting, stopping, and repeating animations on scene objects. Supports different playback modes, timing adjustments, and restoration of original property values.
component.property: Enables or disables automatic playback on initialization.
Scales the playback speed of the animation. A value greater than 1.0 speeds up playback, while values between 0.0 and 1.0 slow it down.
Defines how the animation should be played.
When true, playback is relative to the current state rather than starting from an absolute base state.
Number of times the animation should repeat. Use -1 (or another sentinel value, depending on implementation) to indicate infinite looping.
Restores the original property values after the animation ends.
Reference to the animation timeline that defines keyframes and transitions.

component.name: Trigger
component.summary: Base class for event-driven actions within the UI system
component.details: Triggers respond to various conditions and can execute actions like property changes or method calls. Part of the reactive UI behavior system.
component.property: Target property name to monitor or modify
Associated value for the trigger condition

component.name: OnPropertyChangedTrigger
component.summary: Responds to property value changes on specified nodes
component.details: Monitors a named property on a source node and triggers actions when the property value changes. Useful for reactive UI updates.
component.property: Name or identifier of the node to monitor
Property name to watch for changes

component.name: OnAttachedTrigger
component.summary: Triggers when an element is attached to the visual tree
component.details: Useful for initialization actions that should occur when an element becomes part of the active UI hierarchy.

component.name: EventTrigger
component.summary: Responds to routed UI events (mouse, keyboard, etc.)
component.details: Listens for specific routed events and can execute actions in response. Supports the standard UI event bubbling system.
component.property: Name of the routed event to handle (e.g., "MouseDown", "KeyPress")

component.name: Setter
component.summary: Applies property values when triggered by specified conditions
component.details: Part of the trigger system - sets target properties to specific values when the associated trigger condition is met.
component.property: Triggering condition or state image
Target property name to set
Value to apply to the property

component.name: Handler
component.summary: Executes custom functions when triggered by specified conditions
component.details: More flexible than Setter - can call arbitrary functions on target objects rather than just setting properties.
component.property: Triggering condition or state image
Target object to call function on
Function name to execute on target

component.name: Brush
component.summary: Base class for all brush types used in rendering.
component.details: Brush defines the general interface for drawing surfaces or filling shapes with visual content. It serves as the root for more specific brushes like ColorBrush, TextureBrush, and MaterialBrush, which define concrete rendering behaviors.

component.name: ColorBrush
component.summary: Brush that fills an area with a solid color.
component.details: ColorBrush applies a uniform color to a drawable surface. It is typically used for flat-colored elements such as backgrounds, highlights, or overlays where no texture or material is required.
component.property: The color value used to fill the target area.

component.name: Node
component.summary: Base class for all UI engine nodes.
component.details: Node is the fundamental class for all engine objects (e.g., Node2D, Node3D, RenderPass). It manages shared functionality such as size, layout, visibility, opacity, tags, and data context. You normally work with derived classes rather than creating instances of Node directly.
component.property: Sizing configuration of this element
External spacing around the element
Internal spacing between element border and content
Border definition along each axis
Alignment definition for each axis.
Whether this node is visible in the scene.
If true, node is quickly hidden without triggering full visibility transitions.
Specifies how much of the node is visible within its parent container. Value in range [0.0, 1.0].
Opacity of the node, range [0.0 = transparent, 1.0 = fully opaque].
Tag collection for categorizing or querying nodes.
Data context (used for data binding, similar to XAML's DataContext).

component.name: TextRun
component.summary: Shared concept for text rendering in 2D and 3D nodes.
component.details: This class is not instantiated directly. Instead, it provides the common properties and functionality for text rendering, used internally by higher-level components such as 2D and 3D text nodes. The concept encapsulates text content, resources, formatting options, alignment, and font configuration.
component.property: The short text string displayed in the block, limited to 64 bytes. If you need more space consider using `TextResourceID`.
Font definition used for text rendering. Contains typeface, size, and style information.
Underline style applied to the text.
Additional spacing applied between letters.
Line height multiplier for multi-line text layout.
Extra spacing between characters, beyond kerning.
Forces a fixed width per character (monospace effect).
Removes side bearings (spacing) defined by the font.
component.field: Reference to the font shorthand configuration.

component.name: TextBlockConcept
component.summary: Shared concept for text rendering in 2D and 3D nodes.
component.details: This class is not instantiated directly. Instead, it provides the common properties and functionality for text rendering, used internally by higher-level components such as 2D and 3D text nodes. The concept encapsulates text content, resources, formatting options, alignment, and font configuration.
component.property: Resource identifier for localized text lookup.
Configuration key used when resolving text resources.
Placeholder text displayed when no main text is set.
Defines how overflowing text should be handled (clip, ellipsis, etc.).
Brush definition for rendering placeholder text.
When true, uses the font's full height for layout calculations.
Constrains the content height to the text's bounding box.
Enables automatic word wrapping of the text.
Horizontal alignment of the text within its bounds.
Vertical alignment of the text within its bounds.
component.field: Reference to the owning node using this concept.
Internal view representation of the text.

component.name: Node2D
component.summary: Primary class for 2D UI elements with comprehensive rendering capabilities
component.details: Extends Node with 2D-specific functionality including transforms, visual effects, composition, and event handling. This is the base class for most visible UI elements. \snippet docs/creating_node2d.lua
component.property: Transformation applied during layout calculations. Similar to WPF `LayoutTransform`. Affects size and positioning but does not influence local rendering.
Transformation applied at render time. Similar to WPF `RenderTransform`. Affects how the element is drawn (rotation, scale, skew, etc.) without altering layout.
The origin point for applying RenderTransform. Equivalent to WPF `RenderTransformOrigin`. Defines pivot relative to the element.
Pixel offset applied to the element's content. Can be used for subpixel positioning or scrolling adjustments.
Final transformation matrix applied to the node. Computed result of layout, render, and parent transforms.
Optional render target for offscreen drawing. When set, the node is rendered into this texture/image instead of directly on screen.
Background brush for the element. Equivalent to WPF `Background`. Supports solid color, image, or material.
Foreground brush for the element. Equivalent to WPF `Foreground`. Typically used for text or shape fills.
Shadow applied to the element's box. Equivalent to CSS `box-shadow` or WPF `DropShadowEffect`.
Defines overflow behavior for child content. Equivalent to CSS `overflow`. Controls clipping and scroll behavior.
Decorative ring effect applied around the element. Similar in purpose to CSS `outline` or focus ring indicators.
Custom composition brush for advanced rendering. Equivalent to UWP `CompositionBrush`. Can be used for effects or visuals beyond standard brushes.
Virtual design size when using composition rendering. Defines the expected size for the composition surface.
Whether the element resizes itself to fit its content. Equivalent to WPF `SizeToContent`.
Enables rendering to an offscreen surface before compositing. Useful for caching effects or complex visuals.
Forces use of the composition system even when not required. Equivalent to enabling composition layers for debugging or effects.
Enables caching of rendering results. Similar to WPF `CacheMode`. Reduces redraw cost at the expense of memory.
Snaps rendering to device pixels. Equivalent to WPF `SnapsToDevicePixels`. Improves text sharpness.
Controls whether children are clipped to the bounds of the element. Equivalent to WPF `ClipToBounds`.
Determines if content stretches to fill available space. Equivalent to WPF `Stretch` when applied to child content.
Indicates if the element is currently hovered by pointer/mouse. Equivalent to WPF `IsMouseOver`.
Marks object as ignored during hit testing (mouse interaction).
Hint for how foreground should be rendered. May be used for accessibility, high-contrast, or text rendering optimizations.

method.name: IsFrameSet
method.summary: Check if a specific frame property is set on a Node2D

method.name: SetFrame
method.summary: Set a frame property value on a Node2D

method.name: GetFrame
method.summary: Get a frame property value from a Node2D

method.name: Measure
method.summary: Perform the measure phase of layout for a Node2D
method.details: Calculates the desired size of the node and its children based on content and layout constraints.

method.name: Arrange
method.summary: Perform the arrange phase of layout for a Node2D
method.details: Positions the node and its children within the specified bounds after the measure phase has determined desired sizes.

method.name: GetBounds
method.summary: Get the layout bounds of a Node2D along a specific axis

method.name: GetRect
method.summary: Get the 2D rectangle bounds of a Node2D

method.name: GetBackgroundRect
method.summary: Get the background rendering rectangle for a Node2D
method.details: May differ from the main rectangle due to border radius, shadows, or other visual effects.

method.name: GetSize
method.summary: Utility function for calculating node dimensions with different sizing modes
method.details: Provides convenient access to node sizes with different interpretations of what "size" means in various layout contexts.

component.name: PrefabView2D
component.summary: Container for loading and displaying prefabricated UI components
component.details: Allows loading of pre-designed UI layouts from external resources. Useful for reusable UI components and modular design patterns.
component.property: Scene archive identifier or path
Prefab resource name within the archive
component.field: Hashed value of currently loaded SCA
Hashed value of loaded prefab instance

component.name: TextBlock
component.summary: Concrete implementation of text display combining Node2D and TextBlockConcept
component.details: Primary class for displaying static text with full typography control. Combines 2D rendering capabilities with comprehensive text formatting options.
component.field: Internal reference to the underlying Node2D instance

component.name: Input
component.summary: Interactive text input control with multiple input modes
component.details: Extends TextBlock to provide editable text capabilities. Supports various input types including text, password, numeric, checkbox, and radio button modes.
component.property: Input identifier for forms and data binding
Input behavior type (text, password, etc.)
Current text cursor position
Allow multiple lines of text input
Checked state for checkbox/radio types
component.field: Internal checkmark image for checkbox rendering

component.name: Button
component.summary: Interactive button control for user actions
component.details: Extends TextBlock to provide clickable button functionality. Handles mouse and keyboard activation with customizable button types.
component.property: Button behavior type (normal or submit)

component.name: Label
component.summary: Text label with optional association to form controls
component.details: Displays static text that can be associated with input controls for accessibility. Clicking the label can transfer focus to associated control.
component.property: Identifier of associated form control

component.name: StackView
component.summary: Linear layout container arranging children in a single direction
component.details: Provides flexbox-style linear layout with configurable direction, alignment, spacing, and content justification. Children are arranged sequentially along the specified axis.
component.property: Reverse the order of child elements
Layout direction (horizontal or vertical)
Cross-axis alignment of children
Main-axis distribution of children
Space between adjacent children

component.name: Form
component.summary: Specialized stack view for form input collection and submission
component.details: Extends StackView with form-specific functionality including automatic input collection and submission handling.

component.name: CollectionView
component.summary: Container for dynamic collections of data-driven items
component.details: Manages collections of UI elements, typically data-bound to dynamic data sources. Provides efficient rendering of large item sets.
component.property: Primary layout direction for items
Space between collection items

component.name: Control
component.summary: Base class for interactive UI controls with state management
component.details: Provides common state properties for interactive elements including press, hover, focus, and disabled states.
component.property: Currently being pressed by user input
Interaction disabled, typically grayed out
Mouse pointer is over the control
Control has keyboard focus
Generic boolean value for toggle controls
Visual scale factor for size adjustments

enums.name: ResizeMode
enums.summary: Defines how the window can be resized by the user or system.
enums.enum: The window size is fixed. The user cannot resize or maximize the window.
The user can minimize the window, but resizing and maximizing are disabled.
The user can freely resize the window and maximize it.
The user can resize and maximize the window. A resize grip is displayed in the lower-right corner if the platform supports it.

component.name: Screen
component.summary: Top-level container representing a display surface or window
component.details: Provides the root rendering context for UI hierarchies. Manages screen-level operations like clearing and render target management.
component.property: Background clear color for the screen
Specifies how the window can be resized or displayed
component.field: Internal render target for the screen
Currently set size (to resize window when changed).
Used to set initial window size

component.name: Cinematic
component.summary: Video or animation playback view for media content
component.details: Handles playback of video files or frame-based animations with timing control and fade effects.
component.property: Path to media file for playback
Playback frame rate (frames per second)
Total number of frames in the media
Fade-out duration in seconds

component.name: Grid
component.summary: Grid-based layout container with configurable rows and columns
component.details: Arranges children in a 2D grid pattern with flexible sizing. Supports both fixed and dynamic grid definitions.
component.property: Column definition string (e.g., "1fr 2fr 100px")
Row definition string (e.g., "auto 1fr auto")
Primary fill direction for auto-placement
Space between grid cells
Default width for auto-sized cells
Default height for auto-sized cells

enums.name: Stretch
enums.summary: Specifies how the content of an element is resized to fill its layout area
enums.enum: Do not scale the content; display at its native size
Scale content to fill both width and height, ignoring aspect ratio
Scale content uniformly to fit within the area, preserving aspect ratio
Scale content uniformly to fill the area, preserving aspect ratio but cropping if necessary

component.name: ImageView
component.summary: Displays image content with advanced rendering and scaling options
component.details: Renders static images with support for nine-patch scaling, blend modes, and viewport control. Handles both loaded images and images loaded from file paths.
component.property: Image source path or resource identifier
Direct reference to loaded image
Edge inset values for nine-patch rendering
Content inset values for image positioning
Viewport rectangle for image cropping/scaling
Determines how the image is scaled to fill its allocated layout space
component.field: Hashed value of loaded image resource

component.name: NinePatchImage
component.summary: Specialized image view for nine-patch (stretchable) images
component.details: Renders images that can be stretched while preserving corner and edge regions. Commonly used for UI panels, buttons, and borders that need to scale to different sizes.
component.property: Top edge stretch behavior factor
Bottom edge stretch behavior factor
Left edge stretch behavior factor
Right edge stretch behavior factor
Center region stretch behavior factor
Top-left corner image (non-stretchable)
Top edge image (horizontally stretchable)
Top-right corner image (non-stretchable)
Left edge image (vertically stretchable)
Center region image (stretchable in both directions)
Right edge image (vertically stretchable)
Bottom-left corner image (non-stretchable)
Bottom edge image (horizontally stretchable)
Bottom-right corner image (non-stretchable)

component.name: TerminalView
component.summary: Displays a fixed-size text grid using a monospace layout
component.details: Renders a character matrix (e.g., 8024) where each cell represents a single glyph. Functions like a monospace canvas for text-mode visualization, ideal for console-style output, terminal emulation, or retro graphics where characters act as pixels.
component.property: Buffer width
Buffer height
Cursor position
Selected item index
Draw shadow underneath this view

enums.name: TransitionType
enums.summary: Specifies the type of transition animation to use when navigating between pages.

struct.name: NavigateToPageArguments
struct.summary: Event triggered to navigate to a different page within a PageHost.
struct.field: The URL of the page to navigate to.
The type of transition animation to use during navigation.

struct.name: NavigateBackArguments
struct.summary: Event triggered to navigate back to the previous page in the navigation history.
struct.field: The type of transition animation to use during navigation.

component.name: Page
component.summary: Represents a single page within a document or UI container.
component.details: Used to store navigation related data while all the functionality comes from PageHost
component.property: The title of the page.
The URL path of the page, like "/about".
The transition progress of the page.
component.field: Pointer to Node for quick referencing

component.name: PageHost
component.summary: Container that manages multiple pages and navigation between them.
component.details: Provides functionality for navigating between different Page instances, including maintaining a navigation stack, handling back/forward navigation, and managing page transitions.
component.property: The currently active page.
component.field: Number of entries in the navigation history stack.

enums.name: StyleType
enums.summary: Specifies the classification of a style and how it is applied to components.
enums.details: StyleType determines the purpose and scope of a style definition. Generic styles apply globally to all matching targets, while specialized types define overrides or theme-specific variants for more controlled styling behavior.
enums.enum: Base style applied to all components of the specified target type. Serves as a default visual definition.
Style associated with a specific theme or visual skin. Used to switch appearance dynamically based on active theme.

component.name: Style
component.summary: Defines a reusable set of property values and visual configurations for a target component type.
component.details: Style enables consistent appearance and behavior across multiple components by grouping property definitions under a named style. Each style specifies its target type and classification, such as Generic, Theme, or Override. Styles can be applied globally, by theme, or locally to individual instances, allowing flexible and maintainable UI customization.
component.property: Specifies the component type this style targets. Only components of the given type or its derived types will use the style.
Defines the classification of this style, such as Generic, Theme, Override, Local, or Template, determining its scope and application behavior.
